claims_summary: Central bank with hybrid public-private governance structure exempted from normal government oversight - emergency lending programs concealed until legal compulsion, monetary policy insulated from democratic accountability

governance_structure: Federal Reserve Act (1913) - Establishes hybrid structure
Regional Federal Reserve Banks owned by private member banks
Board of Governors appointed by President (not elected)
Jekyll Island meeting accounts (1910) - Secret planning by bankers
concealment_mechanisms: FOIA exemption for monetary policy deliberations
Bloomberg FOIA lawsuit (2010-2011) forced emergency lending disclosure
GAO audit restrictions for monetary policy operations
emergency_powers: 2008-2009: $16.1 trillion in loans disclosed only after lawsuit
Recipients included foreign banks (Deutsche Bank, Credit Suisse, etc.)
2020 COVID response: Unlimited QE, corporate bond purchases
wall_street_coordination: Federal Reserve Bank of New York executes all market operations
Board members frequently from Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan backgrounds
BlackRock hired for bond purchase programs (conflict of interest)
power_concentration: Interest rate setting affects entire economy
Asset purchases influence stock and bond markets
Dollar dominance maintained through Fed policy coordination

validation_status: Well-documented through Federal Reserve Act, GAO reports, Bloomberg lawsuit disclosures, FOMC minutes/transcripts, and congressional testimony
